      • stripOff

        public static java.lang.String stripOff(java.lang.String s,
                                        char c)
        Strips off all characters 'c' in string 's'. E.g., stripOff("Peter", 'e') returns "Ptr".
        Parameters:
        s - a string
        c - the character to be erased
        Returns:
        a new string with all 'c's stripped off

      • getSeparatorChar

        public static char getSeparatorChar(java.lang.String s)
        Determines the separator character in a given string. The string is searched for a) the system-dependent separator (which may be '\\' in case of Windows), and if not found then b) it is searched for the separator used in JAR files. If none of these is found, 0 is returned.
        Parameters:
        s - a string containing separators
        Returns:
        the separating character, 0 if none of the searched found

      • appendExtension

        public static java.lang.String appendExtension(java.lang.String fileName,
                                               java.lang.String defaultExtension)
        Add a file extension, if the file name doesn't yet have one. Extensions follow the actual file title and are separated by a dot. They are of arbitrary size (Java for DOS, anyone? :).

        If the file name is fully enclosed in double quotes ("), remove them, but don't append an extension.
        If the file name already has another extension, don't change it.
        If the filename only consists of a path, too bad; ext is appended anyway.

        Also, ignore path elements that precede the file name.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The file name to append the extension to.
        defaultExtension - The extension to add, if necessary.
        Returns:
        The file name, with the extension appended, if appropriate.
